Updated November     pm



After hours of hard work and dedication graduating students from the Master of Fine Arts program are finally showcasing their talent in the Wellington B PERIOD Gray Art Gallery PERIOD Beginning Thursday April  through May  the MFA Thesis Exhibition is being displayed in the Gray Gallery for public viewing PERIOD

The exhibition features various metals sculpture ceramic and photography works from the following artists Jesse Bert Brie Castell Daniel Collett Corey S PERIOD Fong Kenneth Lindsey Jervis III Sharon Michelle Massey Benjamin Steven Jensen and Melissa S PERIOD Manley PERIOD

The opening reception was held April  from  p.m PERIOD   p.m PERIOD to honor the contributing artists PERIOD

Jesse Bert Corey Fong Sharon Massey and Melissa Manley are MFA in metal design students PERIOD Brie Castell and Ben Jenson are the only students from the MFA in photography and ceramics programs respectively to exhibit their work in the show PERIOD Daniel Collett and Kenneth Jarvis are both students of the MFA in sculpture program PERIOD

These students have traveled from around the world pursuing their passion for art and gaining the knowledge that they need in order to be successful and confident PERIOD After spending years of their valuable time and money pursing higher education in order to hone in own their natural born talents they will finally be achieving the ultimate success of graduating next month PERIOD

The Gray Art Gallery is located inside the Jenkins Fine Arts Center on Fifth Street PERIOD The Gallery is open Monday through Friday from  a.m PERIOD   p.m PERIOD and Saturday from  a.m PERIOD   p.m PERIOD Beginning on May  and extending throughout the summer the Gallery will be closed on Friday Saturday and Sunday PERIOD
